reviews.review: She's a nice person but she is a very unorganized teacher. Her grading policies feel very unclear, and the course project is all over the place. Long story short the project has people partnered with others from a specific program, however roughly a third of the class didn't get a partner. She isn't doing anything about it and is just telling the students to find a solution that doesn't exist. It's a very confusing class. She becomes easily frustrated with students who don't solve the problems attached to the project she created. It meets for three hours a week, which is a long session as is, but the amount of additional work outside of class is ridiculous for a GenEd. Additionally, the activities in class are very repetitive and show that the professor doesn't put a lot of effort into them.

name: TLPL443
title: Understanding Cross-Cultural Communication for Teaching English Language Learners
description: Credit only granted for: EDCI436 or TLPL443. Formerly: EDCI436. Theories of intercultural communication and techniques for applying them in the teaching of English as a second language (ESL) and content classes. Research and evaluation of selected aspects of a culture as basis for creating, selecting and using culturally-responsive teaching materials and methods.
